verses.text: And king Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim , whom Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.

But neither he, nor his servants , nor the people of the land , did hearken unto the words of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, which he spake by the prophet Jeremiah.\f + \fr 37.2 \ft by…: Heb. by the hand of the prophet\f*

And Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest to the prophet Jeremiah , saying , Pray now unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God for us.
Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people : for they had not put him into prison.
Then Pharaoh’s army was come forth out of Egypt : and when the Chaldeans that besieged Jerusalem heard tidings of them, they departed from Jerusalem. \p
¶ Then came the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto the prophet Jeremiah , saying ,

Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the God of Israel ; Thus shall ye say to the king of Judah , that sent you unto me to enquire of me; Behold, Pharaoh’s army , which is come forth to help you, shall return to Egypt into their own land.
And the Chaldeans shall come again , and fight against this city , and take it, and burn it with fire.

Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Deceive not yourselves , saying , The Chaldeans shall surely depart from us: for they shall not depart.\f + \fr 37.9 \ft yourselves: Heb. your souls\f*

For though ye had smitten the whole army of the Chaldeans that fight against you, and there remained \add but\add* wounded men among them, \add yet\add* should they rise up every man in his tent , and burn this city with fire.\f + \fr 37.10 \ft wounded: Heb. thrust through\f* \p
¶ And it came to pass, that when the army of the Chaldeans was broken up from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army ,\f + \fr 37.11 \ft broken…: Heb. made to ascend\f*

Then Jeremiah went forth out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin , to separate himself thence in the midst of the people.\f + \fr 37.12 \ft separate…: or, to slip away from thence in the midst of the people\f*

And when he was in the gate of Benjamin , a captain of the ward \add was\add* there, whose name \add was\add* Irijah , the son of Shelemiah , the son of Hananiah ; and he took Jeremiah the prophet , saying , Thou fallest away to the Chaldeans.

Then said Jeremiah , \add It is\add* false ; I fall not away to the Chaldeans. But he hearkened not to him: so Irijah took Jeremiah , and brought him to the princes.\f + \fr 37.14 \ft false: Heb. falsehood, or, a lie\f*
Wherefore the princes were wroth with Jeremiah , and smote him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe : for they had made that the prison. \p
¶ When Jeremiah was entered into the dungeon , and into the cabins , and Jeremiah had remained there many days ;\f + \fr 37.16 \ft cabins: or, cells\f*

Then Zedekiah the king sent , and took him out : and the king asked him secretly in his house , and said , Is there \add any\add* word from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*? And Jeremiah said , There is : for, said he, thou shalt be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon.
Moreover Jeremiah said unto king Zedekiah , What have I offended against thee, or against thy servants , or against this people , that ye have put me in prison ?
Where \add are\add* now your prophets which prophesied unto you, saying , The king of Babylon shall not come against you, nor against this land ?

Therefore hear now, I pray thee, O my lord the king : let my supplication , I pray thee, be accepted before thee; that thou cause me not to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe , lest I die there.\f + \fr 37.20 \ft let…: Heb. let my supplication fall\f*

Then Zedekiah the king commanded that they should commit Jeremiah into the court of the prison , and that they should give him daily a piece of bread out of the bakers’ street , until all the bread in the city were spent. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison.
